Name: Cathedral Church of St. Mary
Notes: Foundations laid April 25, 1220. Consecrated 1225, 1258 and when completed in 1266.

Name: Salisbury Cathedral School
Notes: Initially residential, now a private school.

Name: Malmesbury House
Notes: Original known as Copt Hall demolished in 1399, still residential.

Name: The Theological College
Place: North Walk, The Close, Salisbury. SP1 2EG
Notes: Now called Sarum College, an ecumenical study centre.

Name: The Close Wall, Rosemary Lane
Place: Rosemary Lane, North Walk, The Close, Salisbury, also Exeter St. Salisbury
Notes: The ancient wall surrounding the Cathedral close on north, east and south sides. Remnants of Old Sarum Cathedral visible.

Name: The Matron's College
Notes: Accommodation for clergy widows. Established by Bishop Seth Ward and probably designed by Christopher Wren, still functions with original intent.

Name: North Gate
Notes: Two-storey building over and around north entrance to the Cathedral Close.

Name: Mompesson House
Place: Choristers' Green, The Close Salisbury. SP1 2EG
Notes: Town house built for Sir Thomas Mompesson, 17/18th century MP, now a historical exhibit.

Name: Screen, Walls, Piers, Gates and Overthrow of Mompesson House
Place: Choristers' Green, The Close Salisbury. SP1 2EG
Notes: Frontage of house, low wall, iron gate and railings,18th century iron lamps.
